metadata.description: California state-level Veteran services through the VetServices program

programs.program_name: CSAAVE (California Student Aid and Attendance for Veteran Education)
programs.description: Provides educational financial assistance to Veteran students using GI Bill benefits and other qualified educational funding.

eligibility.summary: California Veterans enrolled in accredited educational institutions

programs.description: Assists separating military members with transition planning, career development, and employment services to facilitate successful civilian careers.

eligibility.summary: Active duty service members and recently separated Veterans

programs.description: A $600 million state initiative providing housing assistance and homelessness prevention services to California Veterans experiencing housing instability.

eligibility.summary: California Veterans experiencing homelessness or housing insecurity

programs.description: Certification and support program for service-disabled Veterans starting or expanding businesses in California.

eligibility.summary: Service-disabled California Veterans with business ventures

programs.description: Provides representation and assistance with Veterans Affairs disability claims, appeals, and benefits navigation.

eligibility.summary: California Veterans seeking assistance with VA disability claims

programs.description: Provides mental health services, crisis support, and counseling for Veterans dealing with trauma, PTSD, substance abuse, and other behavioral health needs.

eligibility.summary: California Veterans needing mental health and behavioral health services

programs.description: Supports Veterans incarcerated in California prisons with benefits access, reentry planning, and transition services.

eligibility.summary: Veterans currently incarcerated in California facilities

programs.description: Specialized court programs addressing mental health, substance abuse, and trauma for Veteran defendants through treatment-focused interventions.

eligibility.summary: Veterans involved in the California criminal justice system

programs.description: County-based Veteran services providing direct financial aid, emergency assistance, and support to eligible California Veterans.

eligibility.summary: California Veterans meeting county residency and financial need requirements

programs.description: Provides burial services and cemetery maintenance for eligible California Veterans and their dependents.

eligibility.summary: California Veterans and their eligible family members

programs.description: Expands Medi-Cal coverage for Veterans, improving access to healthcare and coordinating with VA services.

eligibility.summary: California Veterans eligible for Medi-Cal coverage

programs.description: A $38 million grant program providing mental health funding and services to organizations serving California Veterans.

eligibility.summary: California Veterans and organizations providing mental health services to Veterans
